content: रसिक {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [रसोऽस्त्यस्य ठन्] {@--1@} Savoury, sapid, tasteful. {@--2@} Graceful, elegant, beautiful. {@--3@} Impassioned. {@--4@} Apprehending flavour or excellence, possessed of taste, appreciative, discriminating; तद् वृत्तं प्रवदंति काव्यरसिकाः शार्दूलविक्रीडितं <ls>Śrut. 40.</ls> {@--5@} Finding pleasure or taking delight in, delighting in, devoted to (usually in <ab>comp.</ab>); इयं मालती भगवता सदृशसंयोगरसिकेन वेधसा मन्मथेन मया च तुभ्यं दीयते <ls>Māl. 6</ls>; so कामरसिकः <ls>Bh. 3. 112</ls>; परोपकाररसिकस्य <ls>Mk. 6. 19.</ls> {@--6@} Humourous, witty. {@--7@} Fanciful. {@--8@} Lustful. --कः {@--1@} A man of taste or feeling, an appreciator of excellence or beauty; <ab>cf.</ab> अरसिक. {@--2@} A libertine. {@--3@} An elephant. {@--4@} A horse. {@--5@} The Sārasa bird. --का {@--1@} The juice of sugarcane, molasses. {@--2@} The tongue. {@--3@} A woman's girdle; see रसाला also.
